p: Summarizing the research literature, RSO is a unique source of bioactive phytochemicals containing high levels of antioxidant components. Oil yield from the raspberry seed is not high (from 10 to 20%). RSO well-known for its components: fatty acids, vitamin E so appreciated in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals industries. RSO is also known for its high antioxidant capacity and exhibits anti-inflammatory, anti-mutagenic and antimicrobial properties [ 27]. RSO is also used in cosmetics as an efficient moisturizer and emollient which helps to reduce the oxidative stress in skin, is used in cosmetic emulsions for UV protection [ 6].
